‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a great beginner exercise... Clash of Code has too many advanced exercises
Great work I'm the third approval

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This was a fun challenge!

Keep up the great work!
How do you approve the contribution?

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Once you find the pattern, this is easy, but finding the pattern is the fun part.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun clash. Good Challenge.

Good job, @L√™ Danh Trong!

Goal
* Suggest to simplify the wording by deleting "alternating squares. Your task is to compute the sum of a series consisting of".

* Please change [[1st]] to <<1st>> because "1st" is not a variable name.

* Please change [[nth]] to [[n]]<<th>> for a similar reason.

Output
* Please change [[nth]] to [[n]]<<th>>.

Thanks.

Nice looking clash, @L√™ Danh Trong. If I may I'd like to offer some some changes.

INPUT:

<<Line 1:>> A positive integer [[n]], representing the number of terms in the series. # You can remove the "single" part. By saying "A positive integer", we will all understand that it is one integer.

OUTPUT:

<<Line 1:>> An integer, representing the sum of the series up to the [[nth]] term. # We understand that the output of the program should be a single integer... so you can remove the "Your program should output a single" part and replace it with "An integer". 

TEST-CASE 4 and VALIDATOR 4:

Looks okay. You do not need to change it unless you want to. (Please note that some programming languages will not be able to compute really long numbers. Python, for example has a max computation of 4,300 characters.)

REST OF CLASH:

Looks good. I have no more advice on the rest of your contribution.
Shortest mode suits this clash, but it might do for FASTEST mode too!

Happy Coding!
Code-Parser
Thank you a lot for taking the time to check my contribution. I'm gonna edit it now.

Thanks for helping! I'm totally in favor of changing:

* [[1st]] to <<1st>>
* [[nth]] to [[n]]<<th>>

As for simplifying the wording by replacing "alternating squares", I'd like to use "alternating sign squares". I believe it emphasizes the specific nature of the series.

Please upvote if you guys agree with it. I will edit whenever i can.
Absolutely! It was enjoyable. Thanks for approving the contribution!
You could click on the "UPVOTE" button (above this comments segment) to approve the contribution. Thanks

I'm happy to help. Looks a bit better now. üôÇüëç

Take care,
Code-Parser
